intro: Aidia micrantha var. micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered aidia, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
